title: Jacob Elordi Learns a New Accent for a Movie
summary: Jacob Elordi is an actor from Australia who is starring in a new movie called Wuthering Heights. He plays a character named Heathcliffe, and the movie is set in Yorkshire, a place in England. To sound like he is from Yorkshire, Jacob practices a Northern accent in the bath. He says he likes words like 'mek' instead of 'make'. The movie is based on a classic book by Emily Brontë. At the premiere in London, many fans came to see Jacob and his co-star Margot Robbie. The event had decorations to look like Yorkshire, and singer Charli XCX also attended. She wrote music for the film and enjoyed working on it because it was different from her usual style. The film has caused some talk because of its casting and scenes.

background_read: Wuthering Heights is a famous book written by Emily Brontë a long time ago. It tells a dramatic love story set in Yorkshire, England. Movies often adapt books, and actors like Jacob Elordi work hard to play characters correctly, including learning accents. Premieres are big events where fans can see stars and celebrate new films. Music in movies helps set the mood, and singers like Charli XCX sometimes create songs for them.
Article_Structure: WHO: Jacob Elordi, an actor from Australia, and other stars like Margot Robbie and Charli XCX.
WHAT: A new movie called Wuthering Heights, where Jacob practices a Northern accent and Charli writes music.
WHERE: The movie is set in Yorkshire, England, and the premiere was in London.
WHY: To tell a story from a classic book and entertain people, with actors working hard to make it good.

perspectives.description: Jacob shows dedication by practicing his accent to play his role well.
